verses.sanskrit:
जय हनुमान ज्ञान गुन सागर।
जय कपीस तिहुं लोक उजागर॥
verses.transliteration:
jaya hanumāna gyāna guna sāgara।
jaya kapīsa tihuṃ loka ujāgara॥
verses.meaning: Victory to Hanuman, the ocean of wisdom and virtue. Victory to the Lord who is supreme among the monkeys, illuminator of the three worlds.

verses.sanskrit:
राम दूत अतुलित बल धामा।
अञ्जनि-पुत्र पवनसुत नामा॥
verses.transliteration:
rāma dūta atulita bala dhāmā।
añjani-putra pavanasuta nāmā॥
verses.meaning: You are Ram's messenger, the abode of matchless power. Son of Anjani, known as the Son of the Wind.

verses.sanskrit:
महाबीर बिक्रम बजरङ्गी।
कुमति निवार सुमति के सङ्गी॥
verses.transliteration:
mahābīra bikrama bajaraṅgī।
kumati nivāra sumati ke saṅgī॥
verses.meaning: Great hero, you are mighty and brave, possessor of a body as strong as lightning. You dispel evil thoughts and are the companion of the good-minded.

verses.sanskrit:
कञ्चन बरन बिराज सुबेसा।
कानन कुण्डल कुञ्चित केसा॥
verses.transliteration:
kañcana barana birāja subesā।
kānana kuṇḍala kuñcita kesā॥
verses.meaning: Your color is golden and you are beautifully adorned. You wear earrings and have curly hair.

verses.sanskrit:
हाथ बज्र औ ध्वजा बिराजे।
काँधे मूँज जनेऊ साजे॥
verses.transliteration:
hātha bajra au dhvajā birāje।
kāndhe mūñja janeū sāje॥
verses.meaning: In your hands shine the thunderbolt and flag. A sacred thread made of munja grass adorns your shoulder.

verses.sanskrit:
शङ्कर सुवन केसरी नन्दन।
तेज प्रताप महा जग बन्दन॥
verses.transliteration:
śaṅkara suvana kesarī nandana।
teja pratāpa mahā jaga bandana॥
verses.meaning: You are an incarnation of Lord Shiva and the blessed son of Kesari. Your glory and prowess are revered throughout the world.

verses.sanskrit:
बिद्यावान गुनी अति चातुर।
राम काज करिबे को आतुर॥
verses.transliteration:
bidyāvāna gunī ati cātura।
rāma kāja karibe ko ātura॥
verses.meaning: You are supremely wise, virtuous and very clever, always eager to do the work of Lord Ram.

verses.sanskrit:
प्रभु चरित्र सुनिबे को रसिया।
राम लखन सीता मन बसिया॥
verses.transliteration:
prabhu caritra sunibe ko rasiyā।
rāma lakhana sītā mana basiyā॥
verses.meaning: You delight in hearing the Lord's divine stories. Ram, Lakshman and Sita dwell forever in your heart.

verses.sanskrit:
सूक्ष्म रूप धरि सियहिं दिखावा।
बिकट रूप धरि लङ्क जरावा॥
verses.transliteration:
sūkṣma rūpa dhari siyahiṃ dikhāvā।
bikaṭa rūpa dhari laṅka jarāvā॥
verses.meaning: Assuming a tiny form, you appeared before Sita. In a fierce form, you burned down Lanka.

verses.sanskrit:
भीम रूप धरि असुर सँहारे।
रामचन्द्र के काज सँवारे॥
verses.transliteration:
bhīma rūpa dhari asura sam̐hāre।
rāmacandra ke kāja sam̐vāre॥
verses.meaning: Assuming a terrible form, you destroyed the demons and accomplished all tasks for Lord Ram.

verses.sanskrit:
लाय सञ्जीवन लखन जियाये।
श्री रघुबीर हरषि उर लाये॥
verses.transliteration:
lāya sañjīvana lakhana jiyāye।
śrī raghubīra haraṣi ura lāye॥
verses.meaning: You brought the life-giving herb and revived Lakshman. The heroic Sri Ram embraced you with great joy.

verses.sanskrit:
रघुपति कीन्ही बहुत बड़ाई।
तुम मम प्रिय भरतहि सम भाई॥
verses.transliteration:
raghupati kīnhī bahuta baṛāī।
tuma mama priya bharatahi sama bhāī॥
verses.meaning: Lord Ram praised you greatly, saying 'You are as dear to me as my brother Bharat.'

verses.sanskrit:
सहस बदन तुम्हरो जस गावैं।
अस कहि श्रीपति कण्ठ लगावैं॥
verses.transliteration:
sahasa badana tumharo jasa gāvaiṃ।
asa kahi śrīpati kaṇṭha lagāvaiṃ॥
verses.meaning: Lord Sheshnaag with his thousand mouths sings your glory. Saying thus, the Lord of Lakshmi embraced you.

verses.sanskrit:
सनकादिक ब्रह्मादि मुनीसा।
नारद सारद सहित अहीसा॥
verses.transliteration:
sanakādika brahmādi munīsā।
nārada sārada sahita ahīsā॥
verses.meaning: Sanaka and other sages, Brahma and other great saints, Narada, Saraswati and the King of serpents - all sing your praises.

verses.sanskrit:
जम कुबेर दिगपाल जहाँ ते।
कबि कोबिद कहि सके कहाँ ते॥
verses.transliteration:
jama kubera digapāla jahām̐ te।
kabi kobida kahi sake kahām̐ te॥
verses.meaning: Yama, Kubera and the guardians of the four quarters, poets and scholars - none can express your glory adequately.

verses.sanskrit:
तुम उपकार सुग्रीवहिं कीन्हा।
राम मिलाय राज पद दीन्हा॥
verses.transliteration:
tuma upakāra sugrīvahiṃ kīnhā।
rāma milāya rāja pada dīnhā॥
verses.meaning: You rendered great service to Sugriva, presenting him to Ram and giving him the throne.

verses.sanskrit:
तुम्हरो मन्त्र बिभीषन माना।
लङ्केश्वर भए सब जग जाना॥
verses.transliteration:
tumharo mantra bibhīṣana mānā।
laṅkeśvara bhae saba jaga jānā॥
verses.meaning: Vibhishana heeded your counsel and became the Lord of Lanka, as is known to all the world.

verses.sanskrit:
युग सहस्र जोजन पर भानू।
लील्यो ताहि मधुर फल जानू॥
verses.transliteration:
yuga sahasra jojana para bhānū।
līlyo tāhi madhura phala jānū॥
verses.meaning: The sun is thousands of miles away, yet you swallowed it, thinking it to be a sweet fruit.

verses.sanskrit:
प्रभु मुद्रिका मेलि मुख माहीं।
जलधि लाँघि गये अचरज नाहीं॥
verses.transliteration:
prabhu mudrikā meli mukha māhīṃ।
jaladhi lām̐ghi gaye acaraja nāhīṃ॥
verses.meaning: Holding the Lord's ring in your mouth, you crossed the ocean. There is no wonder in this feat for you.

verses.sanskrit:
दुर्गम काज जगत के जेते।
सुगम अनुग्रह तुम्हरे तेते॥
verses.transliteration:
durgama kāja jagata ke jete।
sugama anugraha tumhare tete॥
verses.meaning: Every difficult task in this world becomes easy by your grace.

verses.sanskrit:
राम दुआरे तुम रखवारे।
होत न आज्ञा बिनु पैसारे॥
verses.transliteration:
rāma duāre tuma rakhavāre।
hota na ājñā binu paisāre॥
verses.meaning: You are the guardian at Ram's door. No one can enter without your permission.

verses.sanskrit:
सब सुख लहै तुम्हारी सरना।
तुम रच्छक काहू को डर ना॥
verses.transliteration:
saba sukha lahai tumhārī saranā।
tuma racchaka kāhū ko ḍara nā॥
verses.meaning: All happiness comes to those who take refuge in you. When you are the protector, there is nothing to fear.

verses.sanskrit:
आपन तेज सम्हारो आपै।
तीनों लोक हाँक तें काँपै॥
verses.transliteration:
āpana teja samhāro āpai।
tīnoṃ loka hām̐ka teṃ kām̐pai॥
verses.meaning: You alone can withstand your own splendor. The three worlds tremble at your roar.

verses.sanskrit:
भूत पिसाच निकट नहिं आवै।
महाबीर जब नाम सुनावै॥
verses.transliteration:
bhūta pisāca nikaṭa nahiṃ āvai।
mahābīra jaba nāma sunāvai॥
verses.meaning: Ghosts and evil spirits cannot come near when one utters the name of the great hero Hanuman.

verses.sanskrit:
नासै रोग हरे सब पीरा।
जपत निरन्तर हनुमत बीरा॥
verses.transliteration:
nāsai roga hare saba pīrā।
japata nirantara hanumata bīrā॥
verses.meaning: All diseases and pain are eradicated by constant repetition of brave Hanuman's name.

verses.sanskrit:
सङ्कट तें हनुमान छुड़ावै।
मन क्रम बचन ध्यान जो लावै॥
verses.transliteration:
saṅkaṭa teṃ hanumāna chuṛāvai।
mana krama bacana dhyāna jo lāvai॥
verses.meaning: Hanuman rescues from all troubles those who remember him in thought, word and deed.

verses.sanskrit:
सब पर राम तपस्वी राजा।
तिन के काज सकल तुम साजा॥
verses.transliteration:
saba para rāma tapasvī rājā।
tina ke kāja sakala tuma sājā॥
verses.meaning: Ram, the supreme ascetic king, rules over all. You accomplish all tasks for him.

verses.sanskrit:
और मनोरथ जो कोई लावै।
सोई अमित जीवन फल पावै॥
verses.transliteration:
aura manoratha jo koī lāvai।
soī amita jīvana phala pāvai॥
verses.meaning: Whatever desire anyone cherishes, they obtain the boundless fruit of life.

verses.sanskrit:
चारों जुग परताप तुम्हारा।
है परसिद्ध जगत उजियारा॥
verses.transliteration:
cāroṃ juga paratāpa tumhārā।
hai parasiddha jagata ujiyārā॥
verses.meaning: Your glory is renowned in all four ages and your splendor illuminates the entire world.

verses.sanskrit:
साधु सन्त के तुम रखवारे।
असुर निकन्दन राम दुलारे॥
verses.transliteration:
sādhu santa ke tuma rakhavāre।
asura nikandana rāma dulāre॥
verses.meaning: You are the protector of saints and sages, destroyer of demons, and beloved of Ram.

verses.sanskrit:
अष्ट सिद्धि नौ निधि के दाता।
अस बर दीन जानकी माता॥
verses.transliteration:
aṣṭa siddhi nau nidhi ke dātā।
asa bara dīna jānakī mātā॥
verses.meaning: You grant the eight powers and nine treasures, having received this boon from Mother Janaki (Sita).

verses.sanskrit:
राम रसायन तुम्हरे पासा।
सदा रहो रघुपति के दासा॥
verses.transliteration:
rāma rasāyana tumhare pāsā।
sadā raho raghupati ke dāsā॥
verses.meaning: You possess the elixir of Ram's name and remain eternally His devoted servant.

verses.sanskrit:
तुम्हरे भजन राम को पावै।
जनम-जनम के दुख बिसरावै॥
verses.transliteration:
tumhare bhajana rāma ko pāvai।
janama-janama ke dukha bisarāvai॥
verses.meaning: Through devotion to you, one attains Ram and forgets the sufferings of countless births.

verses.sanskrit:
अन्त काल रघुबर पुर जाई।
जहाँ जन्म हरिभक्त कहाई॥
verses.transliteration:
anta kāla raghubara pura jāī।
jahām̐ janma haribhakta kahāī॥
verses.meaning: At the end of life, one goes to the abode of Sri Ram and is born as a devotee of the Lord.

verses.sanskrit:
और देवता चित्त न धरई।
हनुमत सेइ सर्ब सुख करई॥
verses.transliteration:
aura devatā citta na dharaī।
hanumata sei sarba sukha karaī॥
verses.meaning: One need not hold any other deity in mind. Service to Hanuman gives all happiness.

verses.sanskrit:
सङ्कट कटै मिटै सब पीरा।
जो सुमिरै हनुमत बलबीरा॥
verses.transliteration:
saṅkaṭa kaṭai miṭai saba pīrā।
jo sumirai hanumata balabīrā॥
verses.meaning: All troubles cease and all pain is removed for those who remember the mighty hero Hanuman.

verses.sanskrit:
जय जय जय हनुमान गोसाईं।
कृपा करहु गुरुदेव की नाईं॥
verses.transliteration:
jaya jaya jaya hanumāna gosāīṃ।
kṛpā karahu gurudeva kī nāīṃ॥
verses.meaning: Hail, hail, hail Lord Hanuman! Bestow your grace as our supreme guru.

verses.sanskrit:
जो सत बार पाठ कर कोई।
छूटहि बन्दि महा सुख होई॥
verses.transliteration:
jo sata bāra pāṭha kara koī।
chūṭahi bandi mahā sukha hoī॥
verses.meaning: Whoever recites this one hundred times is released from bondage and attains great bliss.

verses.sanskrit:
जो यह पढ़ै हनुमान चालीसा।
होय सिद्धि साखी गौरीसा॥
verses.transliteration:
jo yaha paṛhai hanumāna cālīsā।
hoya siddhi sākhī gaurīsā॥
verses.meaning: One who reads this Hanuman Chalisa attains success, with Lord Shiva as witness.

verses.sanskrit:
तुलसीदास सदा हरि चेरा।
कीजै नाथ हृदय महँ डेरा॥
verses.transliteration:
tulasīdāsa sadā hari cerā।
kījai nātha hṛdaya maham̐ ḍerā॥
verses.meaning: Says Tulsidas, who is ever a servant of the Lord: 'O Lord, make your home in my heart.'
